option.DisplayText: {{w|Gigantism Plus}}: Show debug messages and logs
option.helptext:
When enabled, debug messages and logs will appear when the mod performs certain functions.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: {{gigantic|Gigantify}} starting equipment for Gigantic ({{r|D}}) players ({{R|new save}})
option.helptext:
A {{gigantic|gigantic}} character would have {{w|gigantic}} equipment when they arrive in Qud. Disabling this option will make for a more difficult start.
The default is {{w|Enabled}}.

The {{gigantic|gigantic}} modifier typically increases the radius of grenades which could represent a significant reduction in starting difficulty for characters who generate with several of them.
The default is {{w|Disabled}}.

option.DisplayText: Make Gigantism ({{r|D}}) eligible for rapid advancement
option.helptext:
({{r|D}})efects aren't typically able to be leveled up and are excluded from rapid advancement by default. When enabled, Gigantism ({{r|D}}) will be included in the list of physical mutations for this purpose.
The default is {{w|Enabled}}.

option.DisplayText: Allow tinkering of {{gigantic|gigantic}} modifier for: ({{R|new save}})
option.helptext:
This makes the {{gigantic|gigantic}} modifier tinkerable, including the availability of the data disk for it. Its tech tier has been adjusted up to 3 so that it will cost at least a {{b|3}} bit to tinker. Tinker I is the required skill.
The default is {{w|Gigantic ({{r|D}}) players}}.

option.DisplayText: Make {{gigantic|gigantic}} items slightly more common for: ({{R|new save}})
option.helptext:
This makes {{gigantic|gigantic}} items a little less rare to find by adjusting their rarity from R2 to R. Some examples of other mods with R rarity: {{spiked|Spiked}}, {{k|Nulling}}, and {{C|Radio Powered}}.
The default is {{w|Gigantic ({{r|D}}) players}}.
